Extract Values from an Excel File Based on Row and Column Identifiers

Source: R/extract_values.R
extract_values.Rd

This function reads an Excel file and extracts structured data by identifying row and column labels using specific suffix patterns or by matching against a predefined list of identifiers.

Usage

extract_values(
  file,
  pattern_row = ".*_row$",
  pattern_col = ".*_col$",
  row_identifiers = NULL,
  col_identifiers = NULL,
  clean_description = TRUE
)

Arguments

file

Path to the Excel file.

pattern_row

A regex pattern to identify row labels (default: ".*_row$").

pattern_col

A regex pattern to identify column labels (default: ".*_col$").

row_identifiers

A character vector of row label identifiers (default: NULL).

col_identifiers

A character vector of column label identifiers (default: NULL).

clean_description

Logical. If TRUE, removes the identified suffix from the description (default: TRUE).

Value

A tibble containing extracted values, including sheet name, row, column, and description.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Extract values using regex patterns
dataset <- extract_values("data/example.xlsx")

# Extract values using a predefined list of labels
dataset <- extract_values("data/example.xlsx",
                          row_identifiers = c("Total Assets", "Total Liabilities"),
                          col_identifiers = c("Year 2023", "Year 2024"))
} # }
